intro: Linaria aequitriloba subsp. fragilis, commonly known as the fragrant toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
